Container.Name: XSS Hunter
Container.Overview: XSS Hunter allows you to find all kinds of cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, including the often-missed blind XSS.
Container.Description: XSS Hunter allows you to find all kinds of cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, including the often-missed blind XSS. The service works by hosting specialized XSS probes which, upon firing, scan the page and send information about the vulnerable page to the XSS Hunter service. [br][br]

Config.Name: NODE_ENV
Config.Description: Set this to the hostname you want the xss probe on. ex: xss.example.com

Config.Name: SESSION_SECRET_KEY
Config.Description: Set this to a long random string

Config.Name: HOSTNAME
Config.Description: Set this to the hostname you want the admin panel on. ex: admin.example.com

Config.Name: XSS_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: Set this to the hostname you want the xss probe on. ex: xss.example.com

Config.Name: PANEL_USERNAME
Config.Description: Set the admin panel username. Note: it has to be an email address if you plan to setup and enable email notification.

Config.Name: PANEL_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Set the password for the admin panel username.

Config.Name: PANEL_USERPASS_LIST
Config.Description: Enable if you plan to use multi-user setup. The variable should be as follows: [\

Config.Name: ALLOW_EMPTY_USERPATH
Config.Description: Boolean value to allow empty userpath. Default set to true.

Config.Name: CONTROL_PANEL_ENABLED
Config.Description: If you want to minimize the attack surface of your instance you can disable the web control panel. This makes it so you'll only receive emails of payload fires (results will still be stored on disk and in the database).

Config.Name: EMAIL_NOTIFICATIONS_ENABLED
Config.Description: Boolean value to enable email notifications. Default is set to: false.

Config.Name: EMAIL_FROM
Config.Description: Set the FROM email address.

Config.Name: OAUTH_LOGIN
Config.Description: Boolean value to enable this feature.

Config.Name: CLIENT_ID
Config.Description: Your Google OAuth Client Id

Config.Name: CLIENT_ID
Config.Description: Your Google OAuth Client Secret

Config.Name: GMAIL_ACCOUNTS
Config.Description: List of Gmail addresses that are allowed to create accounts and login. Atleast one email address is required. If you want to allow anyone to sign up, remove this variable from the .env file

Config.Name: DATABASE_HOST
Config.Description: Set this to the hostname you want the xss probe on. ex: xss.example.com

Config.Name: PORT
Config.Description: Set this to the hostname you want the xss probe on. ex: xss.example.com

Config.Name: POSTGRES_DB
Config.Description: Set the postgres database name. Note: leave defaults set unless you are planning on exposing this to the public internet.

Config.Name: POSTGRES_USER
Config.Description: Set the postgres username. Note: leave defaults set unless you are planning on exposing this to the public internet.

Config.Name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Set the password for the postgres user. Note: leave defaults set unless you are planning on exposing this to the public internet.

Config.Name: SCREENSHOTS_DIR
Config.Description: Directory where payload fire screenshots are stored.

Config.Name: TRUFFLEHOG_URL
Config.Description: Default trufflehog xsshunter-express url.

Config.Name: SENTRY_DSN
Config.Description: Sentry DSN Client Key

Config.Name: SENTRY_ENABLED
Config.Description: Set boolean value to determine if you are using Sentry DSN.

Config.Name: USE_CLOUD_STORAGE
Config.Description: Set whether or not if you are using a cloud storage to save your payload fires.

Config.Name: BUCKET_NAME
Config.Description: Name of your cloud storage bucket.
